page.title: 04Sutton Poyntz 2
page.content: In "The Buildings of Old Weymouth Part 3",Eric Ricketts gives in chapter 8 a summary of the principal buildings of the village,one of which is the old Waterworks.Today the works is unmanned and controlled by computer.Inside is a small collection of items connected with the works.Part of the original pipework is built from the funnel of the SS Great Eastern.Sutton Farm has now been converted into 2 dwellings and houses built in the grounds have now linked Sutton Poyntz onto the main line of development from Weymouth. The village has an automobile body repair shop,an engine and crankshaft grinding unit and a timber works.There are riding stables,the Springhead Hotel has been re-designed recently and the old water mill has been largely restored . Bill Mercer
